#Text=22nd annual ILGA-Europe conference meets in Brussels : in pictures
#Text=Tuesday , October 30 , 2018

#Text=On Saturday , the four day event of the 22nd Annual conference of ILGA-Europe ( International Lesbian , Gay , Bisexual , Transgender and Intersex Association ) ended which was hosted at the Belgian capital Brussels .
#Text=According to the organisers , over 550 LGBTI activists attended this year 's conference for LGBTI equality and human rights in Europe and Central Asia .
#Text=The conference commenced on Thursday , October 24 .

#Text=The theme of this year 's conference was " Politics for Change " , which according to the organisers was an " opportunity to put out a loud call for action towards politicians , institutions , partners and other allies " .

column1: #Text=Three organisations — Arc-en-Ciel Wallonie , Çavaria , and RainbowHouse — helped to organise the conference , the first of its kind in the Belgian capital .
#Text=On Thursday , Development Cooperation Minister of Belgium , Alexander De Croo announced pledging € 500 thousand for LGBTI organisations working for the rights of LGBT+ .
#Text=In his speech , he said " Even in Europe , there is still a gap between fundamental rights laid down in laws and the reality with which the LGBTI + community is confronted .

#Text=Regarding the genital mutilation of intersex children , Yuri Guaiana , an Italian member of the association , told Gay News :  Although Western Europe is one of the most advanced corners of the world in terms of LGBTI rights , there are several issues that arise , such as those relating to the mutilation of intersex children and girls .
